intro: Bryophyllum gracilipes, commonly known as the slender leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Native to regions of Africa and southern Asia, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Bryophyllum gracilipes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
